comment: He was a great professor. Exams every two weeks and cheat sheet for each exam. Recitations are optional and you receive extra credit for going(definitely worth it). His exams were fairly moderate so if you go to recitations and to class his course shouldn't be too difficult.
honestly no clue what he is talking about half the time, most of the class doesn't show up. currently hoping for the best because he assigned 6 exams plus a final.

I had a hard time following the lectures, but his exams are fair and easy in my opinion if you understand the content. For exams, he gave bonus questions and a cheat sheet (both sides). The final is cumulative but if you go to the optional breakout sessions you get extra points. You should be fine as long as you study some outside of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Not the professor I registered for and got switched last minute, so it's unfair I had to get stuck with him. It's evident that he knows physics, he just doesn't know how to teach the problems very well and is very vague and dismissive with any explanations. Breakout sessions are extra credit and he gives a cheat sheet on every exam which helps.
He is a great professor. He takes extra miles to help students. Thanks!

Don't take him. He talks ABOUT problems during lecture, but doesn't go through and solve them and is very vague with any explanation. He's completely clueless and shouldn't be a teacher; he questions and has trouble solving any problem during lecture that hasn't been done beforehand. Take any other professor, they'd be better.
